article: One day, I was working alone on the roof of a new six-story building. When I completed my work, I discovered that I had about 500 pounds of bircks left over! Rather than carry the bricks down by hand I decided to lower them by a pulley , which fortunately was _ to the side of the building on the sixth floor. Fastening the rope at the ground level, I went up to the roof and _ the bricks into a barrel . Then I went back to the _ and untied the rope, _ it tightly to insure a _ fall of the 500 punds of bricks. You know, I only weighed 135 pounds. Due to my _ at being pulled off the ground so suddenly, I lost my presence of mind and _ to let go of the rope. Needless to say, I went on at a rather _ rate up the building. Near the third floor, I met the barrel coming down , which made my collarbone broken, _ only slightly, I didn't stop. At approximately the same time, the barrel _ the ground, and the bottom fell out of the barrel. _ the bricks, the barrel now weighed about 50 pounds. I refer you again to my weight of 135 pounds. _ you might imagine, I began a rapid down. Also near the _ floor, I met the barrel coming up, which made my legs broken. The encounter with the _ slowed me enough to reduce my _ when I fell onto the pile of bricks, and _ , only three vertebrae were broken. However, as I _ there on the bricks in pain, unable to move, and _ the barrel six stories above, I again lost my presence of mind. I let go of the rope!
